instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC: What is PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC? PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on. This can also be missing if the CD3215 chip itself is bad..
definitions.PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD: What is PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC: What is PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC? PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA: What is PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA? This is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on. This can also be missing if the CD3215 chip itself is bad. Each CD3215 in the system needs to be functioning in order for any of them to speak to the charger and negotiate receiving 20v from the charger rather than the default 5v that a USB-C charger puts out before communicating with the system. .
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No power
threads.message:
Hey everybody

I've got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no power 

HISTORY : a customer brought this laptop with no power issue. He said that first there was image issue when moving the screen, but he was able to use it with an external monitor. After that, he said that the laptop stopped powering on at all.

WHAT WAS DONE : I disassembled the motherboard and spotted some corrosion around UB400 chip.

So I think in first place there was an issue with the flex from the screen, because it worked only in certain position - and I can fix it later if I manage to power it up ))

MEASUREMENTS : 

I measured some pins on UB400 : 

PP1V8 LDO - 1.8v
PP3V3 LDO - 3.3v
PP1V1 LDO - 0v
PP1V8 LDOA -1.8v
<SIGNAL>USBC_TB_CC1</SIGNAL> - pulsing from 1V to 2V like a crazy

AMP meter

on power it takes 20.41V from the wall and AMP go up to 0.8A and drops to 0.40A

Is the UB400 - CD3215A dead ?

You'll find some pics around UB400 corrosion

Thank you for your support

Best regards

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No power
threads.message:
You must clean the area and replace damaged components.
All USB-C ports have the same behavior?
Check all in both connection ways.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No power
threads.message:
Hey thanks for your support

Ok I cleaned the oxidized area

All four port have basically same behaviour : it goes up to 0.9amp then drops to around 0.37 amps and drawing 20.41V

I don't see any damaged components, except that PP1V1 LDO pulls 0v instead of 1.1V on UB400,300 <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>,3100

here are all LDO's from all ports :

UB300
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOD</SIGNAL> - 1.8V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> - 0v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOA</SIGNAL> - 1.8v

UB400
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOD</SIGNAL> - 1.8V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TB_LDO</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_TB_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> - 0v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOA</SIGNAL> - 1.8v

<CHIP>U3200</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD</SIGNAL> - 1.8V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> - 0v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA</SIGNAL> - 1.8v

<CHIP>U3100</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD</SIGNAL> - 1.8V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> - 0v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA</SIGNAL> - 1.8v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No power
threads.message: 1V1 LDO should appear only on the powered port...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No power
threads.message:
oh okok then I do have it )))

Should the fans startup when plugin in the mb ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No power
threads.message: Because I don't have fan spin, nor I have an image on external monitor. The monitor seems to detect HDMI output as a source, but external monitor screen remains black

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No power
threads.message:
Looks like board is booted.

Disconnect internal LCD and test external video again.
Also check for USB activity.

Fans will run when CPU gets hot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No power
threads.message:
ok thats cool it boots at least )

All tests were done with the mb outside the case, so normally all cables are already disconnected

But i'll try again.

What kind of usb activity should I expect ?
